org.spongepowered.api.world

Interface Chunk

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BiomeVolume, BlockVolume, EntityUniverse, Extent

    public interface Chunk
extends Extent
    A chunk is a specific grid-aligned partition of a Extent.

    In Minecraft, the chunk is 16 by 16 blocks on the X and Z axes. The height of each chunk varies between worlds.

    • Method Detail

      • getPosition

        com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3i getPosition()
        Get the position of the chunk.

        The returned position is 3-dimensional with the Y-coordinate set to be the base (lowest) Y-position of the chunk. As 3-dimensional chunks do not yet exist in Minecraft, the returned position will always have a y set to 0.

        Returns:
        The position

      • isLoaded

        boolean isLoaded()
        Gets whether or not this chunk is currently loaded.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this chunk is loaded

      • getWorld

        World getWorld()
        Gets the world the chunk is in.
        Returns:
        The world

      • isPopulated

        boolean isPopulated()
        Gets if the chunk has been populated by the generator.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the chunk has been populated.

      • loadChunk

        boolean loadChunk(boolean generate)
        Loads this chunk, and generates if specified and required.
        Parameters:
        generate - Whether or not to generate the chunk if it does not yet exist
        Returns:
        If the chunk was successfully loaded

      • unloadChunk

        boolean unloadChunk()
        Unloads this chunk, if possible.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the chunk unloaded
